If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC721-isApprovedForAll}."},"mintCertificateNFT(uint256)":{"details":"Mint the NFT only if cetificate exists, is published and was not previously minted by the student","params":{"_certificateId":"the certificate ID we want to mint"},"returns":{"_0":"the minted token ID"}},"name()":{"details":"See {IERC721Metadata-name}."},"ownerOf(uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC721-ownerOf}."},"publishCertificate(uint256)":{"params":{"_certificateId":"the certificate ID we want to publish"}},"registerTutor(address)":{"details":"Only ADMINs are allowed to register new TUTORS"},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. devdoc.author: Juan Benitez
devdoc.details: NFT data is saved fully on-chain, inherits from ERC721URIStorage (ERC721 OpenZeppelin NTF)

params._certificateId: the certificate ID we want to close

createCertificate(string,address,uint256.details: Only role TUTOR is able to create certificates.  The certificate ID is a number generated from: the global counter certificatesCreated and the user address.

params._validDays: Amount of days the certificate is valid

returns._0: An array containing all certificates created.

getCertificatesByHolder(address).details: Returns the certificate data plus the NFT token Ids

returns._0: An array of data certificates owned by the user and the NFT tokens ID for them

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

mintCertificateNFT(uint256).details: Mint the NFT only if cetificate exists, is published and was not previously minted by the student

params._certificateId: the certificate ID we want to mint
the certificate ID we want to publish

registerTutor(address).details: Only ADMINs are allowed to register new TUTORS

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

verifyCertificateHolder(address,uint256).details: Verificate the onwerhsip of the NTF as token plus the existence of the record in the contract.

params._certificateId: The certificate Id we want to verify.
params._student: The wallet address of the student to be verified.

returns._0: The student owns the certificate or not.

TUTOR.details: Define access roles, using AccessControl contract (OpenZeppelin)

certificates.details: Mapping of certificates, from certificate id => certificate struct

certificatesHolders.details: A mapping from student address => certificate IDs student is holding => NFT token id minted.

svgHeadCode.details: This is our SVG code for the NFT certificate.

devdoc.title: Contract for deliver on-chain NFT certificates

closeCertificate(uint256).notice: Close a certificate, this status does not allow to mint the certificate

getCertificatesByHolder(address).notice: Fetches the certificates owned by a user

publishCertificate(uint256).notice: Publish a certificate, this status allows to mint the certificate

verifyCertificateHolder(address,uint256).notice: Allows anyone to verificate if a student is holding a certificate

userdoc.notice: Allows a user to obtain NFT certificates for courses or skills.
